name: Spanish Pan-Fried Shrimp with Garlic
author: Luis Luna
summary: A favorite tapas dish, these Spanish shrimp are infused with the flavors of garlic, olive oil, and chile peppers. Easy and authentic! Use as many chile peppers as you can take.
ingredients: ½ cup olive oil, or as needed
1 head garlic, cloves peeled and coarsely chopped
1  dried red chile pepper, seeded and chopped, or to taste
1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, or to taste
directions: Heat 1/4 inch olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add garlic and chile pepper and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute
Remove garlic and chile peppers with a slotted spoon and set aside
Add shrimp to the hot oil
Cook and stir until opaque in color, about 3 minutes
Return garlic and chile peppers to the skillet
Season with salt and cook for 2 more minutes
Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve immediately
